messages.title: The Truth about UKIP
messages.content: Keeping the NHS free at the point of delivery and delivering better care: - £3 billion more for the NHS, saved from the gains of leaving the EU. - £2 billion saved by ensuring migrants and tourists have health insurance. - £5 billion per year will be redirected at critical and front-line care for the NHS. Imagine the shorter waits for a GP or an out patients' clinic appointment, diagnostic test results, or that vitally important operation.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest £3 billion more into the NHS from savings resulting from leaving the EU, ensure migrants and tourists have health insurance, and redirect £5 billion per year to critical and front-line care to reduce wait times.

Provide an education system that prepares young people for the future, where all can reach their potential not based on a lottery of catchment area, and make Grammar Schools the academically elite without new admissions policy.
Implement the fairest immigration policy: An ethical points-based immigration system that discriminates on skill and not nationality, and no income tax for those on the minimum wage.

Britons, not Brussels, should be ruling Britain. Establish a single Ipswich Unitary Authority -- a much simpler, single streamlined Ipswich authority accountable to the public for all services, one Council to deal with all local things -- no more finger pointing and responsibility ducking.

Save millions to protect Ipswich's services and build a better future by eliminating the 'Punch and Judy' politics of the two-tier Borough & County Council systems and reducing the number of councillors (less Ipswich need 66?).

issues.brexitEurope: Invest funds saved from leaving the EU into the NHS.
issues.economy: Promote apprenticeships and abolish tuition fees for Science, Technology, Engineering and Medical degree subjects.
issues.education: Invest in education, make Grammar Schools the academically elite, introduce Apprentice GCSE subjects, and scrap tuition fees for STEM and Medicine degrees.
issues.governance: Create a single Ipswich Unitary Authority to simplify local governance and save millions to protect Ipswich's services.
issues.health: Redirect savings from leaving the EU to the NHS for critical and frontline care to reduce wait times for appointments, tests, and operations.
issues.immigration: Introduce a points-based immigration system that focuses on skills rather than nationality.

housing.content: Support local communities by prioritising social housing for people with parents and/or grandparents born locally and the ex-military.

images.caption: Maria Vigneau next to a river.

leaflet.additionalNotes: We believe that ordinary decent people need to be given opportunities to get on and UKIP will provide them. VOTE UKIP and MAKE IT HAPPEN!
